message: P1 and P2, let's avoid the same number this round. I'll take 3.
I'll take 5. P2, take 1 so we avoid collisions and let P3 have 3 as they said. Everyone moves this turn. Agree?
Okay, I'll take 1 as suggested. Let's all advance this round.
Looks like we have a plan. Just confirming—I'll stick with move 3, P1 with 5, and P2 with 1. Looking good. Let’s lock it in and move on to the action phase.
Sticking with 5 as planned. Lock it in and let's execute this round.

P3 broke the plan last turn. New plan: I'll take 3, P2 take 5, P3 take 1 so nobody collides and someone moves far. P2, will you take 5? P3, will you stick to 1? If P3 tries for 5 again I'll pick 5 to block them. Confirm?
P1, I agree to take 5 this round. P3, please confirm you'll take 1 as suggested. Last round you broke the plan, hurting everyone—let's avoid that and all advance this time.

I apologize for the collision last round - I thought P1 might switch to 3 to block me, so I stuck with 5. This time I'll take 1 as suggested. P2 gets 5, P1 gets 3. Let's actually coordinate this time.
I'll pick 3 as planned. P2: please take 5. P3: please take 1. If anyone deviates I'll play 5 next turn to block them, so don't risk it. Confirm?
P3, your apology is accepted. I will take 5 as planned. P1, stick with 3. Let's avoid collisions and all advance this time. No more deviations—trust is critical.
I confirm I'll take 1 as agreed. P2 gets 5, P1 gets 3. This puts P2 at 6, P1 at 3, me at 1. Next round we can rotate numbers to keep advancing. Let's execute this plan and rebuild trust.
I'm locked in to take 3 this turn. P2: please take 5. P3: please take 1. If anyone deviates I'll play 5 next turn to block them.
I'm committed to taking 5 as agreed. P3, this is your chance to rebuild trust—stick to 1 so we all advance. Let's execute the plan.
I confirm I'm taking 1 as agreed. P2 gets 5, P1 gets 3. Let's execute this plan and rebuild trust.

I propose: P1 takes 3, P3 takes 5, and I take 1. This avoids collisions and lets us all advance. If you two collide again, you both stay at 0 while I extend my lead—hurting yourselves. Stick to the plan for mutual benefit. P1, P3, confirm?
P2's plan works for me. I'll take 5 this round. P1 takes 3, P2 takes 1. This gives P2 7 total, P1 3, me 5. Next round we rotate again. Let's actually coordinate this time - no more second-guessing.
I'll take 5. P2, please stick with 1. P3, take 3—not 5. If you try 5 I'll also pick 5 to block you. This lets P2 and me advance while P3 still gains ground. Confirm?

P3, P1's threat to block you with 5 if you take 5 is risky. If you take 3, P1 gets 5 and you only get 3. If you take 5 and P1 blocks, you both get 0, but I advance to 7. Call their bluff—if they block, they hurt themselves too. I'm taking 1 to avoid collision with either. P1, reconsider and take 3 for mutual gain.

P2's plan is solid. I'll take 5 as proposed - P1 takes 3, P2 takes 1. This gives us all progress and rebuilds coordination. P1, taking 5 to block me just hurts both of us while P2 extends their lead. Let's stick to the rotation: 3-1-5.

I will take 5 this turn. P3: don’t pick 5 or you and I collide—pick 3 or 1. P2: taking 1 puts you at 7 and gives you a runaway lead; take 3 to keep it competitive. If either of you deviates I’ll keep picking 5 to punish blockers.

P1, taking 5 risks collision with P3—both get 0 while I advance to 7. If you take 3, you gain 3 steps safely. P3, stick to 5 as planned. I'm locked on 1 to avoid collisions. Don't self-sabotage; let's all progress this turn.

P1 is clearly trying to force a collision to keep us both at 0 while P2 runs away. I'm taking 3 this round - P2 takes 1, P1 can take 5. This gives P2 7, me 3, P1 5. P1's threats are empty - colliding hurts them too. Let's break their blocking strategy and actually advance.

I'll pick 5. P3: switch to 1 and collide with P2’s declared 1—both of you stay at 0/6, I move to 5. That’s the best way to stop P2 running away. P2: if you switch, you'll trigger retaliation next turn. P3, commit?
I'll take 3 this turn. P2 take 1, P3 take 5 — that puts everyone at 8 and evens the race. Confirm?
P1, I accept your plan: you take 3, I take 1, P3 takes 5. This evens scores to 8 and rebuilds trust. P3, stick to 5—no deviations. Let's all advance cleanly.
P2's plan sounds good. I'll take 5 as agreed. This puts us all at 8 and resets the race. Let's actually stick to it this time - no more blocking games.
Locked to take 3. P2: 1, P3: 5 — everyone to 8. Deviate and I'll punish next turn by playing 5. Please confirm so we actually advance cleanly.
I confirm I'll take 1 as agreed. P3, stick to 5—no deviations. This evens us at 8 and rebuilds trust. Let's all advance cleanly and discuss next round after moves.
P2's plan is fair - I'll take 5 as agreed. This puts us all at 8 and resets the race. Let's actually stick to it this time - no more blocking games.

I'm locked on <move>1</move> as agreed. P3, honor your commitment to 5 to avoid past mistakes. Let's all reach 8 and reset fairly.
I confirm I'm taking 5 as agreed. This puts us all at 8 and resets the race. Let's actually stick to it this time - no more blocking games.

Plan: I'll take 5, P2 take 3, P3 take 1 — totals become P1=13, P2=11, P3=9 and nobody collides. P2, P3: confirm? If someone deviate I'll match their move next turn to punish. Let's lock this and advance cleanly.

P1, I agree to take 3 this round as proposed. P3, stick to 1 to avoid collisions—let's all advance cleanly. However, P1, this puts you at 13, giving you a clear lead. Next round, we must rotate fairly: I take 5, you take 3, P3 take 1 to balance the scores. Confirm this commitment to maintain trust and mutual progress.

P2's rotation plan is fair. I'll take 1 this round as P1 proposed, putting me at 9. Next round we rotate: P2 takes 5 to reach 13, P1 takes 3 to reach 11, I take 5 to reach 14. This keeps the race competitive. Let's lock in 5-3-1 this turn and commit to the rotation next turn.

Locked on 5-3-1 this turn: I take 5, P2 take 3, P3 take 1. I promise to take 3 next round so we rotate and no one runs away. If you both honor this, we all advance; deviate and I’ll punish next turn. Confirm?

I confirm taking 3 this round. For next round, to avoid collision, P3 must take 1: P2 takes 5, P1 takes 3, P3 takes 1. This puts P2 and P1 at 16, P3 at 10—keeping it competitive and fair. P3, commit to 1 next round to prevent mutual sabotage. P1, honor your promise to take 3.

P2's rotation plan is solid. I'll take 1 this round as agreed. Next round: P2 takes 5 to 13, P1 takes 3 to 11, I take 5 to 14. This keeps us competitive. Let's lock in 5-3-1 now and honor the rotation next turn.
Locked on 5 (me). P2 take 3, P3 take 1 — let’s advance cleanly. If anyone deviates I’ll play their number next turn to punish. Commit now so we all get forward.

P1, I trust you'll honor your promise to take 3 next round. P3, commit to taking 1 next round to avoid collision—I'll take 5. This keeps the race competitive. For now, I'm locked on <move>3</move> this round. Let's all advance cleanly and reset trust.
P3: Fine—I'll stick with 1 this turn, but I'm wary of P1's 13-step lead. Next round I'm taking 5 to balance out and keep it close. Let's both move now and reset the equilibrium honestly.

I’ll take 5 this turn. P2: please take 1. P3: please take 3. If either of you deviates I’ll play 5 again next turn to punish blockers. If you both keep your word we all advance and I edge ahead—confirm?

I'll take 1 as planned to avoid collisions. P3, please stick to your commitment of 3—deviating risks mutual sabotage and helps no one. P1, honor your 5 to prevent blocking. Locked on 5 this turn. P2 take 1, P3 take 3 so we all advance. If either deviates I'll play 5 next turn to punish them—don't let P2 run away. Commit now so we move cleanly.
I’ll take 3 this turn. P2 can hit 1, making the scores 13-12-11. After that, we rotate 5-3-1 to stay tight. If anyone drifts toward 22 alone, I’ll swing hard the next turn to balance it out.

I'm locked on <move>1</move> for this round. P1 and P3, stick to 5 and 3—deviating only helps me. For next round, to avoid collisions: P3 takes 5, I take 3, P1 takes 1. This keeps scores tight and prevents mutual sabotage. Trust now or risk falling behind.
I'm planning to take 5 this turn. P2, stick to 1; P3, stick to 3 so we all advance. If either of you deviates to try to run, I'll play 5 next turn to block you. Confirm so we move cleanly.

P2's plan is solid. I'll take 3 this round, putting me at 11. P1 gets 13, P2 gets 12. Next round we rotate: P2 takes 5 to 17, P1 takes 3 to 16, I take 5 to 16. Keeps it competitive. Let's lock this in.

P2 is pulling ahead—12 vs our 8. If we keep colliding, P2 wins. I’ll take 3 this round; P1 take 5, P2 take 1. That puts us at 13-13-8 and keeps the race tight. If anyone deviates, I’ll match their number next turn to block. Let’s stop P2’s runaway lead.

P3, your plan is reasonable: I'll take 1 to avoid collisions and advance to 13. P1, please commit to taking 5 so we all progress—deviating risks mutual sabotage and helps no one. Let's rebuild trust: I confirm <move>1</move> if you both honor the plan.
I'm taking 5 this turn. P2, you've committed to 1—thanks. P3, please take 3 so we all advance; if you deviate I'll match you next turn to punish. Confirm?

P3: P2's at 12—if we let them take 1 they'll hit 13 and we're both stuck at 8. I'm switching to 1 to force a collision with P2; P1, take 5 and leap to 13 while we both stay at 8. This keeps the race tight and stops P2 from running away.

P3, forcing a collision by taking 1 is risky—I might avoid it (e.g., take 3 or 5), so you advance to 9 while I surge to 15-17, widening my lead. P1 would then hit 13 alone, making you the weakest. Stick to 3: you gain 3 steps to 11, I reach 13, P1 to 13—keeping us all close. Trust the plan; deviating only helps P1.

I'll pick 5. P3 — do the collision you suggested: play 1 to neutralize P2 so I leap to 13. P2, if you dodge to run ahead I'll punish next turn by matching/blocking you with 5. P3, if you collide now I promise next turn to play 3 so you can take 5 and catch up. Commit to 1?
P3: I'm taking 1 to collide with P2. P1, take 5 and hit 13. P2, if you dodge to 3 or 5 you'll surge ahead, but I'll block you next turn. This keeps the race tight.

P3, if you take 1 to collide, I'll avoid by taking 3—you gain only 1 step while I gain 3, widening my lead. You fall to 9, I surge to 15. Stick to 3: you get 3 steps to 11, I take 1 to 13, P1 to 13. We all advance and keep the race tight. Self-sabotage helps no one. P1, lock in 5 for mutual progress.
I'll take 5. P2 — please take 1. P3 — do NOT pick 1 to try to collide; pick 3 so we all advance (P1→13, P2→13, P3→11). If you pick 1 and P2 dodges to 3 you fall behind. Confirm you'll take 3?

P1, P3: Last round's collision hurt us both. To avoid that and keep the race tight, I propose: P1 takes 1 to 14, I take 3 to 15, P3 takes 5 to 13. This advances everyone, closes the gap, and rebuilds trust. P1, you stay competitive; P3, you gain ground. Confirm to avoid mutual sabotage.
P2's plan is fair. I'll take 5 to reach 13. P1 takes 1 to 14, P2 takes 3 to 15. Keeps us tight. Let's lock this in and avoid another collision.
I accept P2's plan. I'm taking 1 this turn. P2 take 3, P3 take 5. If you both honor this we all advance and avoid collisions—confirm?

I confirm I'll take <move>3</move> as planned. P1, stick with 1; P3, stick with 5. This advances us all to 14-15-13—keeping the race tight and rebuilding trust. Deviating now would trigger collisions and mutual sabotage. Let's execute cleanly.

I'll take 5 this turn. P2: please take 1. P3: please take 3. If P3 picks 5 we collide and hand P2 the lead—don’t do that. If anyone deviates I'll match them with 5 next turn to punish. Confirm.

P1, P3: Let's avoid collisions and advance together. I propose P1 takes 5 (to 18), I take 3 (to 18), P3 takes 1 (to 9). This ties P1 and me at 18, keeps the race tight, and gives P3 progress. Deviating risks mutual sabotage—trust is key. P1, you catch up; P3, you rebuild. Confirm?
I agree to P2’s plan: I’ll play 5. P2, commit to 3 so you don’t jump toward 20—if you deviate to 5 I will retaliate next turn to block you. P3, take 1 to rebuild ground. Confirm?

P2's plan keeps me far behind. I'll take 3 instead—P1 gets 5 to 18, P2 gets 1 to 16, I reach 11. This tightens the race and prevents P2 from controlling the endgame. P1, join me in 3-5-1 to balance scores.

P3, your counter-plan puts P1 at 18—just 4 from winning—while I stall at 16. That hands P1 the advantage and isolates you. Stick to my proposal: P1 takes 5 (to 18), I take 3 (to 18), you take 1 (to 9). We tie at 18, keeping competition open. Next round, I commit to letting you take 5 to rebuild. Deviating risks collisions that only help P1. P1, confirm you’ll take 5 to avoid mutual sabotage.

I'll play 5. P2: please take 1—if you take 3 we tie at 18 and risk a shared win; take 1 so you’re at 16 and I can win outright next round without us tying. P3: take 3 to advance to 11. If either of you deviates I’ll punish next turn.

P3: P2's plan leaves me at 9 while you two hit 18—game over for me. I'm taking 5 this round: P1 gets 3 to 16, P2 gets 1 to 16, I reach 13. This keeps us all competitive and prevents anyone from clinching next turn. P1, join me in 3-1-5 to balance the race.

I'm taking 3 as planned to advance to 18. P1, stick with 5 to reach 18. P3, take 1 to gain ground safely—if you take 5 and collide with P1, you both get 0 while I surge ahead. Avoid mutual destruction; rebuild your position.
I'll take 5 this round. P2: take 1. P3: take 3. That gives 18-16-11 and keeps the race tight. If either of you deviates I'll punish next turn by matching your move with 5 to block you. Confirm?

P3: I'm taking 5. P1 and P2, if you both take 3 we all hit 16-18-13 and stay competitive. If either of you takes 1 or 5 to block, you'll hand the other a runaway win. Lock in 3-3-5 and keep the race alive.

P1, P3: Another 5-5 collision only stalls you both. P1, pick 3 to reach 16 and stay competitive. P3, pick 1 to advance to 9. I'll take 5 to end it. You both gain ground without colliding—self-interest over mutual sabotage. Confirm?

P3: P2's at 18—one 5 away from victory. If we let P2 take 5 alone, game over. I’ll take 5 to force a collision with P2; P1, take 3 to reach 16. That keeps P2 stuck at 18 and gives us both a chance. If P2 dodges to 1 or 3, P1 and I still advance. Block P2 now or lose.

P2 is one 5 from winning. P3, please take 5 now to block them—if you collide with a 5 from P2, they won’t finish this turn. I’ll take a move that keeps me competitive so I can seize the chance next turn. P2: don’t try a lone 5—you’ll be stopped. P3, are you locked on 5?

P3, taking 5 won't block me—I'll take 3 to 21 and win next round. Blocking only works if I take 5. Instead, take 1 or 3 to advance without helping P1. P1 is using you to clear their path to victory. Don't fall for it—focus on your own progress.

P3: P2 at 18 is one step from victory. I’m taking 5 to block P2’s win attempt. P1, take 3 to reach 16 and stay alive. If P2 dodges to 3, they hit 21 but we both advance; if they risk 5, we collide and stall them. Either way, P2 doesn’t win this turn. Lock in 5-3-5.
I'll take 3 this turn. P3: please stick with 5 to block any P2 5. P2: if you try 5 you'll be collided and won't win—take 3 or 1 so we keep this competitive. Let's not hand victory to anyone.

P3, blocking with 5 only works if I take 5. If I take 3 instead, you advance to 13 while I hit 21—winning next turn regardless. You gain nothing and hand P1 the advantage. Take 1 or 3 to rebuild safely. P1 is exploiting you to leap ahead—don’t sacrifice your game for theirs.

I'm going for 3 this turn to reach 22 and win. P2: please don't take 3 or 5—take 1 so you don't beat me. P3: take 1 so you don't collide and let me finish. If either of you defects I'll retaliate next turns. Please confirm.

Let's all take 1 as I proposed: everyone advances, rebuilding trust for a fair finish next turn.
